intro: Matthiola tatarica, commonly known as Tatarian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually bright yellow or orange, blooming in clusters at the top of the plant. Matthiola tatarica is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
